meanings.definition: To make a small clicking sound.
meanings.sent2: She snicked her fingers to get the baby's attention.
meanings.sent3: The old clock snicked softly in the background.
meanings.sent4: The tiny gears snicked into place with precision.
meanings.sent5: The raindrops snicked against the window, creating a soothing rhythm.

meanings.sent1: He snicked the paper with his scissors.
meanings.sent2: The chef snicked the vegetables into perfect cubes.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally snicked her finger while peeling the apple.
meanings.sent4: The sharp blade snicked through the rope effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The tailor snicked the fabric with precision, creating intricate patterns.

meanings.sent1: There was a tiny snicked on the edge of the table.
meanings.sent2: He noticed a snicked on the surface of the mirror.
meanings.sent3: The cat had a small snicked on its ear from a playful fight.
meanings.sent4: The snicked on the apple revealed its freshness.
meanings.sent5: The snicked on the book cover hinted at its well-loved history.
